Usage: r_excludeDevTeam TeamName
See sys_devteam for allowable team names
---

Name: r_exposureIncidentBlendAmt
Type: FLOATVAR
Value: 0.5
Flags: 0x10000000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Amount of incident lighting for metering modes that blend reflected and incident measurements.
0.0 = Only reflected light
0.5 = Average of reflected and incident light
1.0 = Only incident light

---

Name: r_exposureIncidentMode
Type: INTVAR
Value: 1
Flags: 0x10000000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Blend amount between incident light measurements at the camera vs in the scene.
0 = At the camera position
1 = At surfaces in the scene
---

Name: r_exposureIncidentNumScenePos
Type: INTVAR
Value: 128
Flags: 0x10000000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Number of positions in the scene where measurements are taken (with r_exposureIncidentMode = 1).
---

Name: r_exposureIncidentNumVectors
Type: INTVAR
Value: 64
Flags: 0x10000000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Number of tiled lighting samples taken at each measurement position.
---

Name: r_exposureIncidentSmoothingTime
Type: FLOATVAR
Value: 0.5
Flags: 0x10000000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Seconds taken for incident light measurement to blend halfway towards the current frame's measurement.
---

Name: r_exposureMeterMode
Type: INTVAR
Value: 3
Flags: 0x10000000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: What elements of scene lighting are used for exposure calculations.
0 = reflected light only (average luminance of the scene)
1 = incident light only (illuminance at a spot in front of the camera)
2 = blend of reflected and incident light (controlled by r_exposureIncidentBlendAmt)
3 = same as 2, with clamp on EV compensation based on reflectance of snow and charcoal
---

Name: r_exposureNoiseRatio10EV
Type: FLOATVAR
Value: 5
Flags: 0x10000000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Scene EV at which sensor noise is low enough to be "acceptable" by ISO standards.
---

Type: FLOATVAR
Value: 10
Flags: 0x10000000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Scene EV at which sensor noise is low enough to be "excellent" by ISO standards.

Name: r_glareFilterRatio
Type: FLOATVAR
Value: 10
Flags: 0x4
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Compression ratio on luminances over the threshold. E.g. a ratio of 10 will compress dynamic range by 90% (10:1).
---

Name: r_glareFilterThreshold
Type: FLOATVAR
Value: 500
Flags: 0x4
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Luminance above which the glare filter activates. Default is 500 kcd/m^2.
---

Name: r_gpuDeviceDebugLog
Type: INTVAR
Value: 0
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Set the level of output logging for GPU driver backend systems.
0 = No log output.
1 = All log output.
2 = Backend GPU Device output.
3 = Backend SPIR-V Parse output.
4 = Backend GPU Device Memory output.
5 = GPU Allocator Memory output.
6 = Backend GPU Device Descriptor/Set output.

Name: r_overrideDXGIAdapter
Type: INT
Value: -1
Flags: 0x2400
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: No
Description: Specifies index of the preferred video adapter to be used for rendering (-1=off, loops until first suitable adapter is found).
Use this to resolve which video card to use if more than one DX11 capable GPU is available in the system.
---

Name: r_overrideDXGIFullScreenOutput
Type: INTVAR
Value: 0
Flags: 0x100
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Defines the preferred monitor for fullscreen display.
Defines the preferred output device for fullscreen display, which can be different from the windowed display device.
Usage: r_PreferredMonitor [0=Main Display Window (default)/(1-n) Monitor index]OBS: the output device must be attached to the selected video card. (see r_overrideDXGIAdapter and r_overrideDXGIOutput)
OBS2: many video cards support up to 2 devices connected, which would make the maximum index be 1.
Usage: r_overrideDXGIFullScreenOutput [0=main display output (default)/(1-n)=display index]
---

Name: r_overrideDXGIOutput
Type: INTVAR
Value: 0
Flags: 0x2000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Specifies index of display to use for output (0=primary display).
---

Name: r_profileGraph
Type: INTVAR
Value: 0
Flags: 0x10000000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Shows performance graph for developers.
1 - Plot smoothed times
2 - Plot raw time data
The lower gray line is the 16 ms, the upper the 33 ms vsync target.
Yellow: Overall frame time
Green : GPU time
Blue  : CPU render time
Pink  : Main Thread processing time, if MT is the bottleneck
---

Name: r_profilePipeline
Type: INTVAR
Value: 0
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Displays profiler with detailed graphics pipeline and pass timings
0 - Disabled
1 - Pipeline sections with smoothed timings
2 - All pass labels with smoothed timings
3 - All pass labels with raw timings (unstabilized)

---

Name: r_shadersDeadCodeRemoval
Type: INTVAR
Value: 2
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Enable removal of dead/unused code by shader parser to reduce size of shader bin and shader compilation time.0 - No code removal
1 - Remove unused FX params
2 - Remove unused FX params & structures & functions

---

Name: r_shadersDisassemble
Type: INTVAR
Value: 0
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Enable disassembly from DXC compiled shader. Can be used in conjunction with shadersDebug for varying outputs
Usage: r_shadersDisassemble [0/1]
 0 = Disables the generation of disassembly
 1 = Disassemble SPIRV/DXIL to readable text file in %cache%/shaders/Debug/Disassembly

---

Name: r_shadersEnableExtraCRCChecks
Type: INTVAR
Value: 1
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Perform extra checks to see if a shader can avoid being reparsed or recompiled. Only has an effect in editor. Otherwise acts as if set to 0.
0 - Invalidate shader if shader file (including headers before preprocessing) was changed. (Ie if basically anything changed)
1 - Perform extra CRC checks on shader after preprocessing and parsing. Reparse only if shader code after preprocessing has changed, and recompile only if both shader file and shader code after parsing have changed. (Default)

---

Name: r_shadersMaxConcurrentBackgroundCompiles
Type: INTVAR
Value: 8
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Maximum amount of concurrent shader compilations on background workers. Default is logicalCores/2. Note that the higher the count the more likely it is that the game will stall due to the fact that all background workers are doing shader compilations and our game is using background workers on the MT.
Any negative number resets it to the default.
---

Name: r_shadersPreloadExts
Type: INTVAR
Value: 0
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Preload all shader ext files during initialization (takes a few seconds)
---

Name: r_vulkanBatchCommands
Type: INTVAR
Value: 1
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Change Vulkan batching of commands at end of frame behaviour.
0 = Single submittal of recorded graphics commands. Comes at a performance cost.
1 = Batches all Graphics commands to be submitted at the end of the frame. (Default).

---

Name: r_vulkanCPUValidation
Type: INTVAR
Value: 0
Flags: 0x10002400
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Enable/Disable CPU validation layers for Vulkan backend.
0 = CPU Validation Layers Disabled (Default)
1 = CPU Validation Layers Enabled

---

Name: r_vulkanDescriptorStrategy
Type: INTVAR
Value: 2
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Set the Vulkan Descriptor Pool/Set allocation strategy.
0 = Static  : Single Large Pool for all DescriptorSet allocations - Driver manages allocations from all threads.
1 = Hybrid  : Single Large Pool for Static ResourceSets + Multiple Small Pools for Transient ResourceSets.
2 = Dynamic : Multiple Small (~16KB) Descriptor Pools where each CommandBuffer/Thread has exclusive access.

---

Name: r_vulkanDeviceCheckpoints
Type: INTVAR
Value: 0
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Enable/Disable Vulkan Checkpoint markup/insertion for GPU crash debugging.
0 = Vulkan Device Checkpoints Disabled (Default) 
1 = Vulkan Device Checkpoints Enabled

---

Type: INTVAR
Value: 1
Flags: 0x2000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Attempt to load vulkan PSO cache on startup.
0 = PSO cache is fresh every run.
1 = Attempt to load PSO cache when possible. (Default).

---

Name: r_vulkanProfileEmulation
Type: STRING
Value: AUTO
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: No
Description: Try to emulate capabilities of another machine for Vulkan (useful for validaton)
AUTO                = VP_CIG_BASE_DLSS if validation is enabled, NO_PROFILE otherwiseNO_PROFILE          = None, do not overrideVP_CIG_BASE         = Base config for developmentVP_CIG_BASE-DLSS    = Base config for development (with DLSS)VP_CIG_BASE-RT      = Base config for development (with RT)VP_CIG_BASE-RT-DLSS = Base config for development (with RT+DLSS)
---

Name: r_vulkanSynchronizationStyle
Type: INTVAR
Value: 1
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Change Vulkan Synchronization style between Synchronization2 and original.
0 = Original Synchronization, no split barrier support and transitions are queued on BeginRecording.
1 = New Synchronization2 functionality includes split barriers (Default).

---

Name: r_wireframe
Type: INTVAR
Value: 0
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Can be used to globally set the polygon mode: 
0 (Default): Polygon mode used from Drawcallpackets 
1: Line mode 
2: Point mode
---

Name: region_id
Type: INTVAR
Value: 0
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes

Name: rm_debug_room_overlaps_verbosity
Type: INTVAR
Value: 0
Flags: 0x4
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Determines the verbosity of rm_debug_debug.rm_find_overlapping_rooms. Recommended to set to 3 when looking for potential markup errors.
If this is > 0 the behaviour of rm_debug.room is overriden to show room overlap debugging info rather than atmospheric composition.0: off
1: Show only definite overlaps between rooms comprised entirely of box areas.
2: Also show probable overlaps between rooms made of complex shapes.
3: Also show warnings for rooms that appear to be nested correctly but the algorithm can't be certain.
4: Also show notifications for rooms that ARE properly nested. Not recommended due to spam.
---

---

Name: s_AudioProxiesInitType
Type: INTVAR
Value: 0
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Can override AudioProxies' init type on a global scale.
If set it determines whether AudioProxies initialize synchronously or asynchronously.
This is a performance type cvar as asynchronously initializing AudioProxies
will have a greatly reduced impact on the calling thread.
Be aware though that when set to initialize asynchronously that audio will play back delayed.
By how much will greatly depend on the audio thread's work load.
0: AudioProxy specific initialization.
1: All AudioProxies initialize synchronously.
2: All AudioProxies initialize asynchronously.
Usage: s_AudioProxiesInitType [0/1/2]
Default PC: 0, XboxOne: 0, PS4: 0, Linux: 0

---

Type: STRING
Value: CryAudioImplWwise
Flags: 0x2000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: No
Description: Holds the name of the AudioSystemImplementation library to be used.
Usage: s_AudioSystemImplementationName <name of the library without extension>
Default: CryAudioImplWwise

Name: s_DropListener
Type: INTVAR
Value: 0
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Drop default listener at current location.
Usage: s_DropListener [0..1]
0: Disabled
1: Enabled (client entity zone mode). Default listener's location will remain at location it was 'dropped' within the client entity's zone.
   (good for dropping the listener in a ship or on a planet surface)2: Enabled (world position mode). Default listener's location will remain at location it was 'dropped' in world space.
   (good for dropping the listener in space and testing passbys)

Flags: 0x0

Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes

Usage: s_OcclusionMaxSyncDistance [0/...]
Default: 10 m

Modified: No

Real CVar: Yes

Default: 0.1 (10 cm)

Name: s_WwiseMaxMemorySize
Type: INTVAR
Value: 1048576
Flags: 0x2000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Specifies the maximum size (in KB) that the Wwise audio system implementation will allocate dynamically.
When allocations reach this size, audio will be negatively affected, leading to missing sounds etc.

Default PC: 1GB, Xbox360: 0 , XboxOne: 0, PS3: 0, PS4: 0, Linux: 0

Name: s_cameraViewFStopOverwrite

Modified: No

Real CVar: Yes
Description: The maximum amount of time (in seconds the server is connected to the replication layer) that will be factored into the replication layer's health check. Ideally this should be greater than the average amount of time it takes for a server to fully recover a server crash. Defaults to 300.0 (5 minutes)

Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: A value between 0 and 1 that determines how strongly a disconnecting server will pull the current lifetime average towards them. 0 is the weakest, and 1 is the strongest. Defaults to 0.25

3 = Treat assert as Fatal Error.
4 = Handle assert via Trace Pipeline.

Name: sys_dump_type
Type: INTVAR
Value: 2
Flags: 0x10000000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Specifies type of crash dump to create on windows.
0: Do not create a mini dump
1: Create a small mini dump (stack trace and registers)
2: Create a medium mini dump (stack trace, registers and some small portion of currently referenced heap)
3: Create a full mini dump (stack trace, registers and full heap)
4: Create a full mini dump for crashes matching digests found in [root]\known_digests.txt. Otherwise create a medium mini dump.
---

Description: Enables tracking when more than X MB of RSS Memory is allocated within sys_linux_track_rapid_mem_increase_timeframe_minutes. This enabled the in process memory tracking.
---

Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Configure the timeframe to track rapbid memory allocations in Minutes (Linux Only)

Name: sys_localization_debug
Type: INTVAR
Value: 0
Flags: 0x0
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Toggles debugging of the Localization Manager.
Usage: sys_localization_debug [0..3]
1: outputs warnings
2: outputs extended information and warnings
3: outputs CRC32 hashes and strings to help detect clashes
Default is 0 (off).
---

Name: sys_localization_encode
Type: INTVAR
Value: 1
Flags: 0x2000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Toggles encoding of translated text to save memory. REQUIRES RESTART.
Usage: sys_localization_encode [0..1]
0: No encoding, store as wide strings
1: Huffman encode translated text, saves approx 30% with a small runtime performance cost
Default is 0 (none).
---

Name: sys_maxFps
Type: FLOATVAR
Value: 60
Flags: 0x600
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Limits the frame rate to the specified number.
If sys_maxFps <= 0 the game will run at the highest possible frame rate while not loading, in menu, or paused (default).
---

Name: sys_maxIdleFps
Type: FLOATVAR
Value: 60
Flags: 0x600
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Limits the frame rate to the specified number while loading, in menu, or paused.
If sys_maxFps > 0 AND sys_maxIdleFps > 0 then the lowest of the two values will be used.
If sys_maxIdleFps <= 0 frame rate while loading, in menu, or paused will be controlled by value of sys_maxFps.
---

Name: system.datapipeline.resource.conversion.mode
Type: INTVAR
Value: 10
Flags: 0x4
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: If less than 0 - resource conversions are disabled.
If 0 - the resource conversions will be blocking and run on same thread that it's called from without a limit on concurrent conversions.
Any number above 0 represents the number of concurrent conversions (non-blocking).
In the client this is always interpreted as 0 as we always want blocking conversions.
---

Name: system.log.filter
Type: CHARPTR
Value: 
Flags: 0x10000000
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Filter by specified messages
defines general filter for log events
log_Filter="Foo" - will only log events that matches this filter ("Foo")
log_Filter="-Foo" - all events that matches this filter ("Foo") will be dropped
log_Filter="Foo|-Bar" - combine more filters

Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Enables / Disables Anti precession forces (new model only, it's enforced on the old one). Best to leave it on, it also makes decelerations a bit smoother.
---

Name: v_ifcs2.enable_control_surface_include_wind
Type: INTVAR
Value: 1
Flags: 0x4
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: If set to 1 the aerodynamics speed will include the wind.

Type: FLOATVAR

Flags: 0x80
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes

---

Name: v_ifcs2.limiters_linear_type
Type: INTVAR
Value: -1
Flags: 0x4
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: Changed the used limiter type: 
-1: as defined 
0: NormalizedUniform (stable velocity vector - allows trichording)
1: NormalizedUniformWithMaxRadius (stable velocity vector, like 1 but with max radius - no trichording)
2: NormalizedUniformLateral (stable velocity vector, like 1 but with lateral priority - no trichording)
3: Ellipsoid (stronger cut back off accelerations (stable, strongest cut back on accels)
4  PerAxis (unstable, does not keep velocity vector, allows trichording) 
5  PerAxisWithMaxRadius (unstable, prefers longitudinal, no trichording) 
6: PerAxisLateral (unstable, prefers lateral, no trichording, if longitudinal axis is smaller than lateral axes, ellipsoid is used)
---

Name: v_ifcs2.limiters_pitch_yaw_acceleration
Type: INTVAR
Value: -1
Flags: 0x4
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: -1: as defined 
0: NormalizedUniform (allows 45s)
1: NormalizedUniformWithMaxRadius (stable velocity vector, like 1 but with max radius - no 45s)
2: NormalizedUniformLateral (stable velocity vector, like 1 but with lateral priority - no 45s)
3: Ellipsoid (stronger cut back off accelerations (stable, strongest cut back on accels)
4  PerAxis (unstable, does not keep velocity vector, allows trichording) 
5  PerAxisWithMaxRadius (unstable, prefers longitudinal, no trichording) 
6: PerAxisLateral (unstable, prefers lateral, no trichording. should not be used for pitch yaw)
---

Name: v_ifcs2.limiters_pitch_yaw_velocity
Type: INTVAR
Value: -1
Flags: 0x4
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: -1: as defined 
0: NormalizedUniform (allows 45s)
1: NormalizedUniformWithMaxRadius (stable velocity vector, like 1 but with max radius - no 45s)
2: NormalizedUniformLateral (stable velocity vector, like 1 but with lateral priority - no 45s)
3: Ellipsoid (stronger cut back off accelerations (stable, strongest cut back on accels)
4  PerAxis (unstable, does not keep velocity vector, allows trichording) 
5  PerAxisWithMaxRadius (unstable, prefers longitudinal, no trichording) 
6: PerAxisLateral (unstable, prefers lateral, no trichording, should not be used for pitch yaw)
---

Real CVar: Yes
Description: Clamp drag so that inputs in the same direction won't give you extra Gs

Type: FLOATVAR
Value: 2
Flags: 0x4
Read-Only: No
Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
Description: This is a pattern value for the noise. Low values produce uniformity, high values heterogeneity.Leave it at 2 when in doubt as that is the proposed default value of the fractal noise classes.

Modified: No
Frozen: No
Real CVar: Yes
